stepTitle:
Given the following standard entropies and enthalpies of formation for tin (Sn) in its β (white) and \alpha (gray) forms, determine which allotrope of tin is thermodynamically stable at $$298$$ K using the Gibbs free energy change:

Sn (β-form, white): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$51.2$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
Sn (\alpha-form, gray): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$-2.12$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$44.1$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$

Which option is correct?
